pages.text:
There's value in becoming a member!
Membership is REQUIRED, but the membership cards will provide several benefits, such as discounts at select golf courses.
The cost of membership is $10.00 per year and is valid from January 1
, 2025 –  December 31, 2025
.
You will be prompted to purchase a membership when you sign up for programming and tournaments!
Cardholders will receive the following with their membership:
Area discounts (e.g., 10% off Edwin Watts) - more discounts to come!
Junior greens fees at programming locations (see details below)
Discounted play rates at Pensacola Goofy Golf
Local discounts & junior golf rate details:
Retail and Restaurants:
Edwin Watts Golf:
10% off w/some Restrictions
Hot Spot Barbeque:
10% off participants and all guest
Bubba's Sweet Spot:
Free topping with the purchase of ice cream
J's Bakery & Cafe:
10% off
Topgolf Mobile:
Free round of Mini Golf for cardholder and family with a books reservation
Golf Courses:
Goofy Golf Pensacola Driving Range:
Range Balls
—
Small Bucket $3.00; Medium Bucket $6.00; Large Bucket $9.00
Osceola:
First Tee Member Rate
Scenic Hills:
$5.00 Greens Fee
—
9 Holes Walking,
$10.00 Greens Fee
—18
Holes
Walking
Tanglewood:
$6.00 Greens Fee
—
9 Holes Walking;
$12.00 Greens Fee
—18
Holes
Walking;
Range Balls
—
Small Bucket $3.00
Cypress:
$5.00 Greens Fee—Walking; Range Balls—Small Bucket $2.00; Large Bucket $4.00
A. C. Read:
$5.00 Greens Fee, Par 60
—
Unlimited Walking;
$10.00 Greens Fee, Par 72
—18
holes (age and ability to play);  Range
Balls—Small Bucket
$1.00 (one per day)
Emerald Bay:
20% off Regular Rate; 10% off Twilight Rate for both playing Junior and Adult (Junior must be accompanied by a playing adult)
One Club:
Member Rate;
$9.00 Greens Fee
—9
Holes Walking,
$15.00 Greens Fee
—9
Holes Rid
ing
(some exclusions may apply for tee times)
Marcus Pointe:
Range Balls
—
Small Bucket $4.00 + tax
*Cardholders must present their membership card to receive discounts.
.entry-content

Events Calendar 2025
January
1/19 – Downtown Pensacola Trolley Dinner
February
March
3/2 – Spring Fling Adult-Junior Tournament @ The Club at Hidden Creek
April
4/5 – The North Pensacola Optimist Club Junior Golf Pre-Qualifying Tournament @ Cypress Lakes Golf Club
4/12 – The 8th Annual Golf Ball Gala @ Court of DeLuna Event Space
4/21 – Summer Tour Rules Clinic @ Pensacola Country Club
May
5/9 – Dr. James Pewitt Memorial Golf Tournament @ Tiger Point Golf Course
5/18 – Spring GLS Participant Skills Challenge and Scramble @ Osceola Municipal Golf Course
5/24 – First Tee Week Celebration @ the Goofy Golf Facility
5/27 – Women’s Golf Day @ The Club at Hidden Creek
June
& July
GPJGA Summer Tour:
6/2-6/3: Sugar Sands Showdown @ The Club at Hidden Creek
6/9-6/10: City Championship @ Osceola Golf Course
6/16-6/17: Cook Family Classic @ Marcus Pointe Golf Club
6/23-6/24: The Blue Angel Classic @ AC Read Golf Course
6/30-7/1: Southern Juniors @ Scenic Hills Country Club
Divot Derby
7/13 – Divot Derby Skills Challenge @ First Tee Gulf Coast Training Facility
7/14 – Day 1: 5-13 year olds @ Tanglewood Golf Club; 14-18 year olds @ Osceola Golf Course
7/15 – Day 2: 5-13 year olds @ Scenic Hills Country Club; 14-18 year olds @ Perdido Bay Golf Club
7/16 – Day 3: *18 hole players only* @ Marcus Pointe Golf Club
7/17 – Awards Banquet @ Sanders Beach Community Center
A. Downing Gray Invitational
7/28 & 7/29 @ Pensacola Country Club (by invitation only)
August
8/3 – Fun in the Sun Adult Junior 9 hole scramble @ Emerald Bay Golf Club
8/31 – Downtown Trolley Dinner: Summer Edition
September
9/14 – Mini Golf Championship Hosted by Bubba Watson @ Goofy Golf Pensacola
9/20 – Angie & Bubba Watson Adult Junior 18 hole Scramble @ Tiger Point Golf Club
October
10/10 – Mayor’s Cup @ Osceola Golf Course
November
11/2 – Argo Golf Day @ Osceola Golf Course
11/16 – Fall GLS Participant Skills Challenge and Scramble @ Osceola Municipal Golf Course
December
12/5 – 12/7: Destin Fort Walton Beach Winter Classic
12/14 – Winter Cup Adult/Junior Scramble @ Shalimar Pointe Golf Club
12/29 & 12/30 – Tom Dorsey Winter Classic
.entry-content

.entry-content

About Us
We enable kids to build the strength of character that empowers them through a lifetime of new challenges. By seamlessly integrating the game of golf with life skills curriculum, we create learning experiences that build inner strength, self-confidence, and resilience that kids carry to everything they do.
MORE THAN A SPORTS PROGRAM FOR KIDS & TEENS
Our Mission:
First Tee Gulf Coast is a youth-serving organization that teaches golf as a life-long sport to instill character education through the game’s inherent “Nine Core Values.”
Since the founding of our Local Chapter in 2003, we have worked to spread character education and junior golf to the counties (Bay, Escambia, Okaloosa, Santa Rosa, and Walton) of the Florida Panhandle through 102 National School Programs in area (K-5) schools and 15 Golf Course program sites.
Incorporating the Summer Tour of the Greater Pensacola Junior Golf Association and presenting the annual Divot Derby Week (est. 1958), we strive in particular to reach young people who otherwise might not have an opportunity to learn and play the game of golf and to learn its inherent values. First Tee Gulf Coast is committed to growing the game while ensuring that our programs are accessible and affordable to youth of all backgrounds, diversities, social strata and physical abilities, and always regardless of income or ability to pay.
